definition.name: NXxpcs

symbols.doc: The symbol(s) listed here will be used below to coordinate datasets with the same shape.

definition.doc:
X-ray Photon Correlation Spectroscopy data (results).
see: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sZrhLlzER9nuEWmPSLbWcfsgH_0DlBI9QrGRBQdKRQg/edit#gid=0

field.name: definition
field.doc: Official NeXus NXDL schema to which this file conforms

field.name: entry_identifier
field.doc: Unique identifier for the experiment.

field.name: entry_identifier_uuid
field.doc: (optional) UUID identifier for this entry.

field.name: scan_number
field.doc:
Scan number (must be an integer).
NOTE: Link to collection_identifier.

field.name: start_time
field.doc: Starting time of experiment, such as "2021-02-11 11:22:33.445566Z".

field.name: end_time
field.doc: Ending time of experiment, such as "2021-02-11 11:23:45Z".

field.name: frame_sum
field.doc:
Two-dimensional average along the frames stack.
average intensity v. time

field.name: g2
field.doc: One-dimensional time correlation as function of delay time (tau).

field.name: g2_errors
field.doc: Standard deviation of the g2 correlation values.

field.name: tau
field.doc: Delay time corresponding to the g2 correlation values. As in :math:`g_2(\tau)`.

field.name: C2
field.doc: Two-time correlation, two-dimensional.

field.name: g2_twotime
field.doc: Sum across the diagonals of ``C2``. Also known as ``g2full``.

field.name: g2_partials_twotime
field.doc: ``g2`` by subset of frames.

group.name: instrument
group.doc:
XPCS instrument Metadata.
Objects can entered here directly or linked from other objects in the NeXus file (such as within ``/entry/instrument``).

field.name: incident_energy
field.doc: Incident beam line energy (either keV or eV).

field.name: incident_energy_spread
field.doc: Spread of incident beam line energy (either keV or eV).

field.name: incident_polarization_type
field.doc:
Terse description of the incident beam polarization.
The value can be plain text, such as ``vertical``, ``C+``, ``circular left``.

field.name: extent
field.doc: Size (2-D) of the beam at this position.

field.name: description
field.doc: Detector name.

field.name: distance
field.doc: Distance between sample and detector.

field.name: count_time
field.doc: Exposure time of frames, s.

field.name: frame_time
field.doc: Exposure period (time between frame starts) of frames, s

field.name: beam_center_x
field.doc: Position of beam center, x axis, in detector's coordinates.

field.name: beam_center_y
field.doc: Position of beam center, y axis, in detector's coordinates.

field.name: x_pixel_size
field.doc: Length of pixel in x direction.

field.name: y_pixel_size
field.doc: Length of pixel in y direction.

group.name: masks
group.doc:
Data masks or mappings to regions of interest.
Fields in this ``masks`` group describe regions of interest in the data by either a mask to select pixels or to associate a *map* of ROIs with a (one-dimensional) *list* of values.

field.name: mask
field.doc:
ROI mask
The ``units`` attribute should be set to ``"au"`` indicating arbitrary units.

field.name: dqmap
field.doc:
ROI index array.
The values of this mask index the $Q$ value from the the ``dqlist`` field.
The ``units`` attribute should be set to ``"au"`` indicating arbitrary units.

field.name: dqlist
field.doc: 1-D list of $Q$ values, 1 for each ROI.

field.name: dphilist
field.doc: Array of $\varphi$ value for each pixel.

field.name: sqmap
field.doc:
ROI index array.
The values of this mask index the $|Q|$ value from the the ``sqlist`` field.
The ``units`` attribute should be set to ``"au"`` indicating arbitrary units.

field.name: sqlist
field.doc: 1-D list of $|Q|$ values, 1 for each ROI.

field.name: temperature_set
field.doc: Sample temperature setpoint, (C or K).

field.name: temperature
field.doc: Sample temperature actual, (C or K).

group.name: ROI
group.doc:
Region(s) of interest.
NAME: The NeXus convention is to use all upper case to indicate the name (here ``ROI``) is left to the file writer. In our case, follow the suggested name pattern and sequence: roi_1, roi_2, roi_3, ... Start with ``roi_1`` if the first one, otherwise pick the next number in this sequence.

group.name: NOTE
group.doc:
Any other notes.
NAME: The NeXus convention is to use all upper case to indicate the name (here ``NOTE``) is left to the file writer. In our case, follow the suggested name pattern and sequence: note_1, note_2, note_3, ... Start with ``note_1`` if the first one, otherwise pick the next number in this sequence.
